subject: RE: [junit] Usage of JUnit with VAfJ
msgSnippet: Thomas, We have set up the following structure in VAJ and found it to work quite well (for our needs of course). Project        Package            Class ...
messageBody:
Thomas,

We have set up the following structure in VAJ and found it to work quite
well (for our needs of course).

Project Package Class
---------------------------------------
SampleP com.foo.one One
Two
Three
com.foo.two Four
Five
Six
SamplePTests com.foo.one.tests OneTest
TwoTest
ThreeTest
com.foo.two.tests FourTest
FiveTest
SixTest

We also have a project that encapsulates every test in the system. We use
that to run AllTests before releasing code.

If you need more help or any more suggestions, let me know.

-Jason


> -----Original Message-----
> From: tsmets@... [mailto:tsmets@...]
> Sent: Thursday, July 05, 2001 4:50 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Usage of JUnit with VAfJ
>
>
>
>
> Has someone an opinion on where to place the JUnit tests
> in Visual Age for Java so they don't go away with the
> production code ?
> _ New project(s) ?
> _ New packages(s) ?
>
> or simply specific names & removed them with a script ?
>
> Tx,
>
> thomas,
